emuInput.TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Fifth Avenue High School basketball team celebrating, including James Lightfoot, Ramon Singleton, Charles Cook, Lawrence Daniels, and Clarence Shepherd wearing light colored jerseys, with Coach George Cupples at center, after defeating Westinghouse High School at Allderdice High School gymnasium
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 3, 1956, pg. 31, reads: "Fifth Meets Oliver for Crown - After Oliver - There was plenty of jubilation at Allderdice High School by these Fifth Avenue players Tuesday afternoon after they had defeated Westinghouse to win the championship in Section One of the city basketball race and qualify to play Oliver at Pitt Stadium Friday night. The players in white jerseys were the five iron men who played the entire game for Fifth.  From left to right, they are James Lightfoot, Ramon Singleton, Charles Cook, Lawrence Daniels and Clarence Shepherd.  That's Coach George Cupples smiling broadly in the front row. - Harris Photo."
